Scan.Line: I can help you with many things, dear, but this is not one of them.
We can talk once the case is closed. Stay focused on your task.
This woman's name is Anna Taylor. She's been found dead in her home in the Notting Hill district (loc=G). Here's the address. Maybe you should go there and investigate…
To learn more about the personality of a suspect, it's good to ask other people what they think about them.
Did you think of asking her what she thinks about the victim?
What about asking one of the forensic experts?
I don't know what to say about this subject.
Anna was the President of the club, and we have this place thanks to her. She was my partner and we owe her so much.
Yes, I admit that Anna was a difficult person, and to be honest she was a bad Bridge player. It's her money that made her President of the club.

My name is Rose Butterfly. I'm a florist. Bridge is more than just a passion to me, and Anna was my partner.
I'm happy to see new players coming.
I really don't know what to say about this.
I love to make cream cakes. Sugar is still legal, isn't it?
I love to make cream cakes. Sugar is still legal, isn't it?
It's true. I confess. I sent a cake to Anna in order to get her sick and forfeit tomorrow's tournament. I never wanted her to die!

Bridge is a game with such intensity... I love the adrenaline rush of the tournaments. @ There's an important one tomorrow with a big cash prize. With the right partner, I have a good chance to win it.

Anna was supposed to be my partner, but she sucked at Bridge. Her death is a tragedy I would have never wished upon her, though it's true that it will allow me to have a better partner for tomorrow and, hopefully, win the big prize.

It was always difficult to get Anna on the phone, since she refused to have a cell phone.
You need to be careful with the Floxglove flower. It's dangerous because of the digitalis it contains. But it's beautiful nonetheless.
It's true. I wrote this letter. I will speak frankly since you know the tensions between myself and Anna.
I'm a florist, so I know a lot about flowers.
I don't recognize this, should I?
Anna was the president of the Bridge club, and we owe a lot to her. She was the teammate of one of our best players, Rose (char=09). Rose is here today.
Rose is competitive, and she often argued with Anna because they were losing more and more often. But they most likely reconciled because Rose sent a cake to Anna (char=07) yesterday.
My name is Jenny May, and I'm a veterinarian. It's my day off today, but I'm totally exhausted after working more than 12 hours yesterday.
I would like to help you, but I don't know anything about this subject.

Anna asked me a few times to pass by her place and check on her cats. Poor little ones, they had a cholesterol problem.@ I kept telling Anna not to feed them human food, but I think she was doing it anyway.
I heard Rose (char=09) on the phone with a delivery man. She was trying to get a cake delivered to Anna (char=07).

I discovered Bridge only recently and love it! I lose often, not like Rose (char=09), who wins almost every single tournament! There is one tomorrow, actually, with a big cash prize for the winning team.
I don't know Anna's phone number. I had no reason to call her.
I do use many dangerous substances when I have to put down animals, but definitely not digitalis.
I've never seen this letter before.
I need more info before I can do that research.
He's a good fellow who saved my life on more than one occasion when I was...let's just say...on the borders of legality
A quick Internet search found that she was president of a Bridge club in Leicester Square (loc=D).
She's registered for a Bridge tournament tomorrow with a big cash prize for the winner. Guess who was supposed to be her partner? BINGO! Our victim, Anna.
I'm not the one who can help you with this.
I've discovered that the cake was delivered around 8pm to Anna Taylor. The credit card with the name "Rose Butterfly" paid for the order.
You should pick up the phone first before I can analyze it. (ui=Tutorial) Press the "Goodbye" button and scan the "Communication Devices" card to pick up the phone as evidence.

I can't believe these old things still exist! Luckily it's linked to the network with the same usual wires. I was able to find the last call, yesterday at 6:15pm. It came from the phone of a lady named Rose Butterfly (char=09)
A corpse is a mystery that an autopsy attempts to solve, but honestly I'm not sure this person would have wanted to be opened with my scalpel.
The woman died around 10:30pm yesterday. Her heart just stopped. @ We have found an unusually large amount of digitalis, a poisonous plant residue which can provoke a cardiac arrest. (itm=04)
To each his own. My speciality is medicine, especially that of those who no longer move.
Doctor Schrödinger's theories are useless. The cats died of digitalis poisoning. (itm=04)
Criminals are complex beings. I need a little more information to figure this out.
Ah! The Chief Officer… There's so much to say about this man, but I'm pretty sure now's not the time.
An old lady who grew up during the war, and who was extremely stingy with her money.

A compulsive fighter who will do whatever it takes to get what she wants. She makes her presence loud and clear with her extreme quirkiness. You will most likely find her at the Leicester Square Bridge Club (loc=D).
A young lady, very serious, who works as a vet. You could say that she has succeeded in life. She is now looking to give a meaning to it.
Each object has a criminal history related to it, but this one isn't necessarily linked with your current investigation.
In California, an American was sentenced to 16 years in prison for killing 18 cats and injuring 3 others. ...I don't know if this information will be really useful to your investigation.
Wasting such a delicious looking cake, that is criminal indeed. Try to find out who sent it.

This particular deck is used to play bridge. It's a game played by teams of 2, where one partner can become what is called "the dummy". In some countries the dummy is called "the dead".@ Anna Taylor was part of a bridge club in Leicester Square (loc=D).
Criminals are becoming more wary of phone tapping.

Poison is often used by killers who don't like physical violence. The serial killer Marie Becker, also called the Black Widow, was famous for using digitalis. @ Remember that getting the right dosage of poison is difficult, and it can sometimes kill by accident.
Our victim, Anna Taylor, was part of a Bridge Club in Leicester Square (loc=D). Apparently, her partner did not want her to participate in the tournamant.
My microscope doesn't really work so well on people.

I need evidence to preform an analysis. Did you pick up the object you want me to analyze?@(ui=Tutorial) Get out of Interrogation Mode and scan the Evidence Category card of the object you want to pick up.
Who could be so cruel as to kill a sweet little kitty.... Unfortunately, animal corpses are not my area of expertise.
My analysis confirms traces of digitalis (itm=04) inside the cake. The quantity might not have been harmful to you or I, but would have been fatal to an elderly woman like the victim.
Scientifically, there's nothing to say about the cards. The criminologist might be able to help you more.
Scientifically, there's nothing to say about the phone. The Hacker might help you on this.
Digitoxin or digitalis is a cardiac glycoside extract from a flower commonly called the Foxglove or in latin (i)Digitalis purpurea(/i).
Unfortunately, it's a letter without any identifiable fingerprints.
